SCRIPT.LINE: Late at night, you find yourself in a strange laboratory. The air hums with electricity, and mysterious devices line the walls.
Oh! You're finally awake. I was beginning to worry the temporal displacement might have caused permanent damage.
Temporal displacement? What are you talking about? Where am I?
You don't remember? The experiment... the machine... Something went wrong. We need to figure out what happened before it's too late.

PATHS.CHOICE: What experiment? I don't remember anything!
Show me this machine you're talking about
Who are you? Can I trust you?

SCRIPT.LINE: Your memory loss is more severe than I thought. Listen carefully - we were working on a time travel device.
You volunteered to be the first test subject, but something went wrong during the jump. You've been unconscious for hours.
Time travel? That's impossible... isn't it?
Look around you! The temporal energy readings are off the charts. We've torn a hole in spacetime itself!
As if responding to her words, the laboratory lights flicker ominously, and you hear a strange humming sound growing louder.

PATHS.CHOICE: We need to fix this immediately!
Maybe we should evacuate first...
Show me proof that time travel is real

SCRIPT.LINE: Kurisu leads you to a massive device in the center of the laboratory. It pulses with an otherworldly blue light.
This is it - the Temporal Displacement Engine. Three years of my life went into building this machine.
But look at the readings! The temporal field is still active. It's creating dangerous fluctuations in the timeline.
It's... beautiful. But also terrifying. What does it mean that it's still active?
It means we're stuck in a temporal loop. Every moment we delay, the damage to reality gets worse.

PATHS.CHOICE: Can we shut it down safely?
What if we use it to go back and prevent this?
Is there another way to fix the timeline?

SCRIPT.LINE: I understand your confusion. My name is Kurisu Makise - I'm a neuroscientist and theoretical physicist.
We've been working together for months on this project. You trusted me enough to risk your life for science.
But I don't remember any of that. How do I know you're telling the truth?
Look at your hands. Do you see those scars? You got them helping me build the temporal stabilizer last month.
You look down and indeed see small scars on your hands that you can't remember getting.
I know this is overwhelming, but I need you to trust me. The fate of our timeline depends on it.

PATHS.CHOICE: Alright, I'll trust you. What do we need to do?
I need more proof before I can trust you
This is too much. I'm leaving.

SCRIPT.LINE: You're right! We need to act fast. The temporal distortion is growing exponentially!
Alarms begin blaring throughout the laboratory as Kurisu rushes to the main control panel.
I need you to help me recalibrate the quantum field harmonics. Follow my instructions exactly!
I'll do whatever it takes. Just tell me what to do!
There! See that blue switch? Turn it to position 7 while I adjust the temporal flux compensator!

PATHS.CHOICE: Follow her instructions precisely
Question her instructions first
Try to help but hesitate

SCRIPT.LINE: That's... actually brilliant! If we can travel back to before the experiment went wrong...
But it's incredibly dangerous. One small change could create a paradox that destroys everything.
What's the alternative? Let reality collapse around us?
You're right. We have to try. But we need to be very careful about what we change in the past.
The time machine begins to glow brighter, as if responding to your decision.

PATHS.CHOICE: Let's go back together
I should go alone - it's safer
Maybe we should reconsider this plan

SCRIPT.LINE: The humming noise gradually dies down, and the laboratory lights stop flickering. A sense of calm returns to the air.
We did it! The temporal field has stabilized. The timeline is safe!
I can't believe we actually pulled that off. My memory is starting to come back too.
Your trust in me saved us both. Without your help, I never could have shut down the machine in time.
But this experience has taught us something important - some powers are too dangerous for humanity to wield.
So what happens to the time machine now?
We'll dismantle it together. Some discoveries are meant to remain in the realm of theory.
Reality blurs around you as the time machine activates. When your vision clears, you're in the same laboratory - but something feels different.
We made it! Look, there I am in the past preparing for the original experiment.
This is incredible! But how do we convince your past self without creating a paradox?
We have to be very careful. Let me approach myself and explain the situation.
You watch as Kurisu carefully approaches her past self and begins explaining the situation.
She believes me! We're going to prevent the accident together. The timeline will be safe!
You might be right. If the temporal field collapses completely, we need to be far away from here.
How far is far enough when we're talking about reality itself breaking down?
I... I don't know. Maybe there's nowhere far enough. We have to try to fix this instead.
As you reach the exit, you see the temporal distortions spreading beyond the laboratory walls.

PATHS.CHOICE: We can't run from this. Let's go back and fix it.
Keep running and hope for the best

SCRIPT.LINE: Look at these readings! The quantum field measurements are completely off the charts.
This level of temporal distortion is only possible if we've actually manipulated time itself.
These numbers... they're incredible. But what does it all mean?
It means we're in serious trouble. Now do you believe we need to act quickly?

PATHS.CHOICE: Yes, I believe you now. Let's fix this!
Show me the time machine itself

SCRIPT.LINE: Shutting it down safely is our best option, but it requires precise timing and coordination.
Tell me exactly what I need to do.
We need to gradually reduce the temporal field strength while maintaining quantum stability.
One wrong move and we could make the situation much worse.

PATHS.CHOICE: Let's do this carefully and methodically
Maybe time travel is safer after all

SCRIPT.LINE: There might be another way... What if we could stabilize the timeline without shutting down the machine?
How would that work?
We could try to create a temporal anchor - something that locks our timeline in place.
It's theoretical, but it might be safer than the other options.

PATHS.CHOICE: Let's try the temporal anchor idea
That sounds too risky. Let's shut it down normally.

SCRIPT.LINE: Thank you for trusting me. Together, we can fix this mess and save our timeline.
What's our first step?
We need to assess the damage and decide on our approach. Let me show you the time machine.

PATHS.CHOICE: Show me the machine
Let's start working on a solution immediately

SCRIPT.LINE: I understand your skepticism. Look at these research notes - they're in your handwriting.
This... this does look like my writing. But I still don't remember any of this.
The temporal displacement affected your memory. But the evidence is all here.
We don't have much time to convince you. Will you trust the evidence?

PATHS.CHOICE: The evidence is convincing. I'll help you.
I need to see the actual time machine

SCRIPT.LINE: As you reach the exit, you find the door won't open. The temporal distortions have sealed you inside.
I'm sorry, but there's no escape. The temporal field has locked down the entire facility.
So we're trapped here until we fix this?
Yes. Our only choice is to work together and repair the timeline.

PATHS.CHOICE: Fine. Let's fix this together.
Show me what we're dealing with

SCRIPT.LINE: Wait, that's not the right switch! You've made it worse!
The laboratory shakes violently as the temporal distortions grow stronger.
I'm sorry! How do we fix this?
We have no choice now. We have to use the time machine to go back and prevent this mistake!

PATHS.CHOICE: Use the time machine to fix our mistake

SCRIPT.LINE: Good! The field is stabilizing, but it's not completely fixed yet.
What do we need to do to finish the job?
One more careful adjustment should do it. Are you ready?

PATHS.CHOICE: Let's finish this properly
Maybe we should try the time travel option instead

SCRIPT.LINE: I can't let you go alone. This is my responsibility too.
But if something goes wrong, at least one of us should survive to try again.
You're right, but I'm the one who understands the machine better. Let me go instead.
No, we should face this together.

PATHS.CHOICE: You're right. Let's go together.
Let Kurisu go alone since she knows the machine better

SCRIPT.LINE: You're having doubts about time travel? I understand - it is incredibly risky.
What if we make things worse? What if we create a paradox?
Those are valid concerns. Maybe we should try the shutdown procedure first.
But we need to decide quickly - the temporal distortion is growing stronger.
